page.title: 03ATTITUDES CONTINUED
page.content:
MRS COLE A FARMERS WIFE THINKS LIFE IN THE VILLAGE IN THE 1980's IS GOOD BUT CAN BE STRESSFUL WITH THE FEARS OF NUCLEAR WAR. MARGARET BARTON A TEACHER, FEELS IT IS BAD TO SEE SO MUCH YOUTH WASTED. MRS KING A RETIRED DISTRICT NURSE THINKS LIFE IS VERY FAST AND EXPENSIVE AND CAN BE DIFFICULT WITH REGARD TO MANAGING FINANCIALLY. RICHARD DAY A SALES REPRESENTATIVE THINKS IT IS A VERY WARM COMMUNITY AND HE IS ONE OF FOUR GENERATIONS OF HIS FAMILY LIVING IN THE AREA.
THESE ARE JUST A FEW OF THE RESIDENTS FEELINGS OF LIVING TODAY IN THE AREA OF HOLBEACH DROVE.
